Package de.server.controller.goods

Class UnitController

java.lang.Object
de.server.controller.goods.UnitController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/unit") public class UnitController extends Object
The role Controller class outputs a list of all existing units. It is possible to create new units. Units can also be changed and deleted, but only if they are not yet used in another table.

  • Method Details

    • getUnits

      @GetMapping(path="/", produces="application/json") private org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Unit>> getUnits()
      Method returns a sorted list with all units.
      Returns:
      json list with all units

    • createUnit

      @PostMapping(path="/{unitName}", produces="application/json") private org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Unit> createUnit​(@PathVariable String unitName)
      Method creates a new unit, but only if it does not yet exist.
      Parameters:
      unitName - Name of the unit
      Returns:
      Http Status code: Create if a new unit has been created, otherwise no content and created unit.

    • deleteUnit

      @DeleteMapping(path="/{unitName}", produces="application/json") private org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<net.minidev.json.JSONObject> deleteUnit​(@PathVariable String unitName)
      The method only deletes a unit from the list if it has not yet been used.
      Parameters:
      unitName - unit name
      Returns:
      message in Json format and Http status code

    • updateUnit

      @PutMapping(path="/{oldUnitName}/{newUnitName}", produces="application/json") private org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<net.minidev.json.JSONObject> updateUnit​(@PathVariable String oldUnitName, @PathVariable String newUnitName)
      The method only changes the name of a unit if it has not yet been used in the Goods table.
      Parameters:
      oldUnitName - old unit name
      newUnitName - new unit name
      Returns:
      message in Json format and Http status code
